channel.title: Shell Scripting on Peach Colony
channel.description: Recent content in Shell Scripting on Peach Colony

item.title: Chapter 2. Getting Started
item.description: 2.1 Scripting Languages Versus Compiled Languages Most larger scale programs are written in a compiled language, such as Fortran, Ada, Pascal, C, C++ or Java. Compiled language are efficient, but usually work at a low level. Scripting languages are: Shell, Python, Perl, Ruby The advantage of scripting languages is that they are often higher level, being able to deal with objects such as files and directories more easily. The disadvantage of scripting language is that they are less efficient.
